content:
If you have 9 teams in total, but two of the teams have 4 players instead of 3, you can still organize a round-robin tournament where each team plays every other team once. However, you will need to make some adjustments to the schedule to account for the fact that two of the teams have an extra player.

One way to do this would be to have the two teams with 4 players each play each other twice, while the other teams play each other once. This would result in a total of 36 games, just like in the previous example.

To create the schedule, you can use a spreadsheet or a piece of paper to make a table with the team names down the left side and the dates or times across the top. Then, fill in the table with the match-ups for each game.

For example, if you have the following teams:

Team 1 (3 players)
Team 2 (3 players)
Team 3 (3 players)
Team 4 (3 players)
Team 5 (3 players)
Team 6 (3 players)
Team 7 (4 players)
Team 8 (4 players)
Team 9 (3 players)

Your schedule might look something like this:

| Date/Time | Team 1 | Team 2 | Team 3 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1/1 10am |  |  |  |
| 1/1 11am |  |  |  |
| 1/1 12pm |  |  |  |
| 1/2 10am |  |  |  |
| 1/2 11am |  |  |  |
| 1/2 12pm |  |  |  |

You would then fill in the match-ups for each time slot, making sure that each team plays every other team once, except for Teams 7 and 8, which will play each other twice.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
